attributes.action: make an URGENT PUBLIC STATEMENT to explain why people like Tam Dalyell are allowed to take away what must be tons of documents which are the property of the people when he retired from his role as an employee of the people of this country.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Tam Dalyell claimed the cost of storage bookcases for the '50 or so years of Hansard which I own'.  He doesn't OWN it, it belongs to the people of this country and like other employees, when they leave, he should have left it behind.  If he wishes to purchase the paperwork (in the same way that I would have to purchase it if I wanted a copy of Hansard) then that is up to him.  Nobody should be allowed to take away official government documentation when they leave office.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament. http://www.parliament.uk
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
